description: Students taking BE 209 are required to be enrolled in BE 200 and to have completed the physics and chemistry laboratories scheduled during the freshmen year. BE 209 is the first labortory course in the Bioengineering curriculum. It is required for both BSE and BAS majors. It is intended for the fall semester of the Sophomore year.
name: BIOENGINEERING LAB I

values.comments:
This is a survey course introducing students to the breadth of bioengineering. The
course consists of weekly guest lectures and a series of small projects and reports that
allow students to explore different facets of bioengineering.
Some students who took this course felt that it “was a great course” that “gave
very good exposure to bioengineering,” but many also felt that there was too much “busy
work.” The course includes many guest lectures by people in different fields of
engineering and several writing assignments
Some students found the guest lectures to “spark” interest and inspired students to
“want to do research in bioengineering.” However, some also would have preferred a
clearer lecture format with “basic, straight” definitions explained at the beginning of
class.
Students found the course to be “suitable as an introductory course,” and said that
it was “easy, yet informative and effective.”

Students taking BE 209 are required to be enrolled in BE 200 and to have
completed the physics and chemistry laboratories during the freshmen year. BE 209 is the
first laboratory course in the Bioengineering curriculum. It is required for both BSE and
BAS majors. It is intended for the fall semester of the sophomore year.
Overall, students found this class “challenging”, “enjoyable”, and beneficial.
Students appreciated this as their first “hands on experience” in bioengineering, and they
feel that they learned skills and concepts that they will use in their future. Also, students
were happy to “get a real taste of the major” through this course.
(No qualitative comments concerning the professor were provided.)
The course involved a lot of teamwork, which could either lessen or increase the
workload depending on group dynamics. The six-hour labs were long, but students felt
that they went by quickly. Generally, students felt that the course is challenging and timeconsuming.
A significant part of the course involves statistics, for which previous
experience is helpful, but not necessary.
Fewer than eight student comments were submitted for this course.
